name: PRODA
description:
PRODA is a PropTech start-up founded in January 2017. We focus on solving core data processing pain points in real estate, and believe that unstructured data is a key barrier to digital transformation in the industry.

PRODA is combining real estate expertise with data science to develop machine
leaning-enabled software, with the aim of truly automating many analysis and
reporting tasks for real estate professionals. Our software automatically captures
property data from spreadsheets, before standardising, error-checking & securely
storing it. This enables users to standardise and access all their data, regardless of
the country, asset class or company that it originated from.

To find out more, please visit www.proda.ai

team.name: Charles Williams
team.bioHtml: Founder at PRODA.ai CFA, CAIA & CQF certified. Former Associate Director with major PERE fund Manager.

team.title: CTO
team.name: Matthew Eric Bassett
team.bioHtml: CTO @trivium-real-estate • Worked at @NBCUniversal • Founder @Gower Street • PhD Mathematics

jobs.title: Business Analyst
jobs.description:
Opportunity for an entrepreneurial candidate to join an exciting early-stage PropTech start-up based in central London 

About PRODA 

At PRODA (www.proda.ai) we are building AI-enabled software to automatically capture, standardise and quality check rent roll data. Our goal is to empower real estate professionals to quickly gain actionable insights from their data and use software more effectively.  
The commercial real estate industry relies on rent rolls as the core data source, but these are frequently inconsistent, inaccurate and inaccessible, posing challenges for real estate professionals. Through automated data standardisation, PRODA can: 
- Increase process efficiency, through faster report generation.
- Improve data-driven decision making, by ensuring the accuracy of input data. 
- Enhance data access, by building repositories of clean, standardised data. 
In addition, PRODA easily integrates with existing systems, to ensure consistent dataflow through the whole organisation. 

The role 

We are looking for a creative, diligent personable individual who is as comfortable deep in the data model as they are out visiting with clients. Someone that can cover a wide range of functions within a growing tech start-up. We launched v1 of our software in October 2019 and are iterating the model based on the needs of our clients. The ideal candidate will have prior experience or else a keen interest in the commercial real estate industry, statistics and problem-solving. In this role, you will work in the real estate team with the Chief Product Officer, sales team, software development team, and with PRODA’s users. 
This is a permanent, full-time role. The core hours are 9AM–6PM Monday–Friday.
Salary: £25–30k p/a + equity options, depending on experience. 

Key responsibilities

Client Success: you will liaise directly with real estate and PropTech companies who are using PRODA. You will support them and use their feedback to set priorities for the product development pipeline. In many cases, perform their tasks alongside them to support them but also so that we can better understand target areas for software improvements.
New user training: Improve process around and deliver product demos and new user training.
Data model management: you will be classifying and categorising property data with respect to the PRODA model and manage the model’s rules and business logic.
Product development: you will formulate new ways to improve the data model, and work with our team of data scientists and software engineers to shape product development.
Analysis: you will evaluate large sets of data to spot key patterns and develop new features for machine learning algorithms.

Skills and experience

Creative and flexible problem-solving skills.
Exceptional attention to detail.
Enthusiasm to work as part of a small start-up team.
Excellent interpersonal skills and comfortable working directly with clients. 
Strong Microsoft Excel skills.
Prior experience in the commercial real estate industry, with practical knowledge of working with rent roll data, is a bonus but not required.
Interest in data science and machine learning.

Working at PRODA 

As an early-stage start-up, life at PRODA is fast-paced and collaborative. Our day-to-day work is solving interesting problems using smart technologies, and we pride ourselves on an environment where we can rapidly develop new skills, learn from each other, and truly see the impact of our work. 
We believe that our product is transformative, and we work hard to ensure it reaches its potential. Our team is our greatest asset: we are a close-knit group who pull together to achieve our goals, but we also like to have fun!
•	We are based at a WeWork on London's South Bank. Our modern, open office has communal areas, quiet spaces, table games, and unlimited drinks and snacks (plus beers in the evenings). We will be moving to private offices at workingfrom.thehoxton.com/london-southwark/ in March!
•	We offer full zero-excess private health insurance with optician and dental cashback.
•	We proactively seek professional development opportunities, including training and peer-to-peer learning sessions, visiting specialists, and attending conferences and meetups.
•	We hold regular team meals and social activities.
Please note that we cannot sponsor employment visas at this time.

jobs.title: Front-end Developer
jobs.description:
Who are we?

Through Machine Learning-assisted algorithms PRODA applies the concepts of standardising and normalising data to empower Real-Estate professionals to gain actionable insights over how their business operates. With automating the data ingestion process, PRODA brings the benefits of increased accuracy, an ability to self-correct, and overall process enhancements to allow our customers to focus on what matters.
We believe that our product is transformative, and we strive to realise that potential. PRODA would not be possible without a diverse set of people bringing various perspectives, experience, and skills - our team is our most treasured asset. All should feel included, heard, and equal at PRODA; no-one can know who will provide the next game-changing solution!

All of Engineering, Product, and Design form a set of cross-functional teams working towards shared objectives - OKRs - realised and constructed in collaboration. We currently have four (4) teams, all with sizes varying from 2-4 Engineers; the sizes of these teams are due to double in size over the next 12 months. The teams are largely autonomous, with best-practices and resources provided as a set of minimum constraints.

What you'll be doing:

- Shipping value-add products affecting the experience for both internal departments and external customers.
- Collaborate with the wider Engineering department to learn and share through code reviews, mentoring, and technical talks. Wouldn't it be nice to know why Haskell does <*insert esoteric monadic composition law here>*? How Kubernetes handles orchestration?
- Champion best practices in code, front-end architecture and wider development processes.
- Optimise performance problems to our many tables; we have a combination of ag-grid and custom-drawn solutions (for the more aggregated data size sensitive use-cases).

What we'd like you to have:

- Building UIs with focus on accessibility - a11y - and an overall empathetic User Experience.
- Familiarity with CSS pre-processors and/or CSS-in-JS.
- Have worked with style guides, understanding the benefits of Style guide-Driven-Design (SDD) for componentizing larger projects.
- Familiarity with Elm or the TEA pattern.
- Understanding of Typescript.
- Experience with testing frameworks for both isolated components and being certain the application 'works'.
- An understanding or enthusiasm for functional programming; why would I reach for React.FC over classes (, or HOCs)?
- Familiarity with Docker.

We do not discriminate based on race, sex, religion, age, sexual orientation, civil status, disability, nationality or gender identity.

Please note that we cannot sponsor employment visas at this time.

jobs.title: Senior Business Analyst
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Company: PRODA LTD
Location: Central London
Position: Senior Business Analyst
Salary: £35,000 + equity options (depending on experience and qualifications).
Company Details: PRODA is a UK based company providing AI-enabled software to automatically capture, standardise and quality check rent roll data (www.proda.ai). Our goal is to empower real estate professionals to quickly gain actionable insights from their data and use software more effectively. The commercial real estate industry relies on rent rolls as the core data source, but these are frequently inconsistent, inaccurate and inaccessible, posing challenges for real estate professionals. Through automated data standardisation, PRODA:
• Increase process efficiency, through faster report generation.
• Improve data-driven decision making, by ensuring the accuracy of input data.
• Enhance data access, by building repositories of clean, standardised data.
Position Details:
We are looking for someone to support and later direct management of the PRODA real estate data model. We launched V1 of our software in October 2019 and are iterating the model based on the needs of our clients. The ideal candidate will have prior experience in the commercial real estate industry or in Proptech. In this role, you will work directly with the Chief Product Officer, the software development team, and PRODA’s users.
Job Type: Full – Time
Duties and responsibilities
• Data model management: you will be classifying and categorising property data with respect to the PRODA model and manage the model’s rules and business logic.
• Product development: you will formulate new ways to improve the data model, and work with our team of data scientists and software engineers to shape product development.
• Analysis: you will evaluate large sets of data to spot key patterns and develop new features for machine learning algorithms.
• Client relations: you will liaise directly with real estate and PropTech companies who are using PRODA. You will support them and use their feedback to set priorities for the product development pipeline.
• Preparing monthly reports detailing activities and progress against established goals, identifying challenges and proposing action plans;
Skills and experience required
The suitable candidate must have:

• University degree
• 1+ year Prior experience of working in the commercial real estate industry;
• Practical knowledge of working with rent roll data is essential (1+ year experience);
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (the candidate should be comfortable to work directly with clients);
• Strong research and analytical skills are essential;
• Creative and flexible problem-solving skills;
• Exceptional attention to detail;
• Strong SQL-Lite Skills;
• Strong Microsoft Excel skills;
• Interest in data science and machine learning.

Closing Date: 12th March 2020

jobs.title: Software Engineering Manager
jobs.description:
Who are we?

Through Machine Learning-assisted algorithms PRODA applies the concepts of standardising and normalising data to empower Real-Estate professionals to gain actionable insights over how their business operates. With automating the data ingestion process, PRODA brings the benefits of increased accuracy, an ability to self-correct, and overall process enhancements to allow our customers to focus on what matters.
We believe that our product is transformative, and we strive to realise that potential. PRODA would not be possible without a diverse set of people bringing various perspectives, experience, and skills - our team is our most treasured asset. All should feel included, heard, and equal at PRODA; no-one can know who will provide the next game-changing solution!

All of Engineering, Product, and Design form a set of cross-functional teams working towards shared objectives - OKRs - realised and constructed in collaboration. We currently have four (4) teams, all with sizes varying from 2-4 Engineers; the sizes of these teams are due to double in size over the next 12 months. The teams are largely autonomous, with best-practices and resources provided as a set of minimum constraints.

What you'll be doing:

- Support and coach our Engineers through regular 1-on-1s, providing a relationship of transparent feedback and improvement.
- Work closely with the Head of Engineering to make sure teams are performing well and are best-equipped for the challenges ahead.
- Engage across departments to best push the technical evolution of our product.
- Work alongside other Engineering and Product leaders to help develop optimal processes and culture.

What we'd like you to have:

- Experience with managing people and teams.
- A strong Software Engineering background able to communicate technically to best assist the Engineers in their technical decisions.
- Able to articulate technical concepts to non-technical people, and business needs with those more technically minded.
- Understanding of the basic concepts of Machine Learning and its applications.
- Functional programming knowledge would be a bonus as our primary application services combine Haskell, Scala, and Elm.

We do not discriminate based on race, sex, religion, age, sexual orientation, civil status, disability, nationality or gender identity.

Please note that we cannot sponsor employment visas at this time.
